creator: hauser@acm.org
text:
With http://ant.apache.org/manual/CoreTasks/loadfile.html it is certainly
possible to place a "get"-result into a property, but creating an interim file
for this appears to be an overkill.
If I missed something and this is already possible, please describe it in the
file on the URL above.


See the equivalent request for the telnet task
(http://nagoya.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=20207)

Have a look at the proposal/http tasks in CVS. These work as is, but with each
version of java having different (inconsistent) behaviour, we've held back
committing them till someone (anyone!) can migrate them to Jakarta commons
HttpClient. If you are preprared to deal with the inconsistences, use them today.
creator: stevel@apache.org

text:
Just a few days ago (during ApacheConEU2006) the http section was rewritten. And
according to the 1.7 philosphy to break the huge Ant code base into smaller
peaces it is an AntLib.

ATM in the sandbox
http://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/ant/sandbox/antlibs/http/

But that does support the result property
http://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/ant/sandbox/antlibs/http/trunk/docs/http-antlib.html
  destfile     -  the file where to store the retrieved file. 
  destproperty -  the name of a property to fill with the returned content. 
                  Ignored if destFile is set
